item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: kelvinator1
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Suggested text: Our website address is: https://icontactafricasolutions.com/dir.

Comments

Suggested text: When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

Suggested text: If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Cookies

Suggested text: If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Suggested text: Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Who we share your data with

Suggested text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

Suggested text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

Suggested text: If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where your data is sent

Suggested text: Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: kelvinator1
item.content:encoded:
• Home
  • About
    • Ventures
    • Entrepreneur
  • Portfolio
    • Website Development
    • Digital Marketing
  • My Services
    • Website Development
    • Digital Marketing
  • Hire Me

2+

YEARS OF DIGITAL EXPERIENCE

About Me

The creative adult is the child who survived.

From age 10 I’ve always knew I was meant for something greater than myself, and it was not until I was at university that I realized my true purpose of socially impacting other peoples lives.

Being a social entrepreneur is my passion. I wake up every morning excited to lead a team of highly motivated and skilled youths towards the green economy of Zimbabwe.

In my 3 years of being the founder of Refuse iT, I’ve found that the waste management industry particularly in Zimbabwe has a long way to go in terms of digitization and innovation.

Apart from running Refuse iT, I also co-founded an outsourcing company called iContact Africa Solutions.

My Vision

To deliver measurable results to clients

  My Mission

To use digital channels to reach customers, build brand awareness, and promote products and services.

  My Goal

To learn the diverse cultures of people who I will work with both locally and internationally.

My Skills

I am skilled and experienced.

I have over 2 years of experience in Digital Marketing, Website Development, Project Management, Data Analytics, Business Development and Sales Management.

2022 Business Management

Tony Elumelu Foundation

I participated in the 2022 Tony Elumelu Foundation entrepreneur competition, and was awarded non-equity based grant funding for my Startup. I also became a 2022 TEF Alumni.

Learn More

2022 Digital Marketing

Hubspot Academy

I was certified by HubSpot Academy in Digital Marketing, after having completed the course.

Learn More

2023 Front-end Development

Meta

I was certified by Meta in Front-end Development, after having completed the course.

Learn More

2024 Data Analytics

Hotjar

I was certified by Hotjar, after having completed the courses.

Learn More

My Services

I provide the best service for you.

I am a detail oriented person, who values working within an agreed timeframe and maximises on quality services for all my clients.

Digital Marketing

I have been deemed knowledgable and skilled in applying digital marketing practices with an inbound mindset. I have been tested on the content and best practices and have an understanding of creating search engine-friendly content, optimising a website, creating a social media strategy, using video to engage audience, amplifying messaging with advertising, and measuring the results of marketing efforts.

Book my services

Website Development

I have been deemed knowledgable and skilled in coding and building interactive web pages using HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript. I also have in-demand skills to create professional page layouts using industry-standard tools such as Bootstrap, React, and Figma. GitHub repositories for version control, content management system (CMS) and how to edit images using Figma.

Book my services

Data Analytics

I specialize in data driven approaches, by making use of user behavior analytics tools that gives you insights into how users behave on your site, what they need, and how they feel, fast. I help Product teams, and Marketing teams that want to go beyond traditional web and product analytics so they can empathize with and understand their users—to connect the dots between what's happening and why it happens, so they can improve the user experience (UX) and create customer delight. Book my services

Best Freelancer

Tafadzwa Kevin Chingombe

Some of my accomplishments include:

  • Representing Zimbabwe at the BRICS Youth Innovation Summit (2023)
  • Becoming a 2022 Tony Elumelu Foundation Alumni, where I also received seed capital grant funding as well as certified in Business Management.
  • Selected as one of the top 15 finalists in the Generation Unlimited Youth Innovation Challenge in Zimbabwe (2022)

Some of my skill set includes:

  • Sales Management
  • Data Analytics
  • Cybersecurity
Book my services Menu

About Me

The creative adult is the child who survived.

From age 10 I've always knew I was meant for something greater than myself, and it was not until I was at university that I realized my true purpose of socially impacting other peoples lives.

Being a social entrepreneur is my passion. I wake up every morning excited to lead a team of highly motivated and skilled youths towards the green economy of Zimbabwe.

In my 3 years of being the founder of Refuse iT, I've found that the waste management industry particularly in Zimbabwe has a long way to go in terms of digitization and innovation.

Apart from running Refuse iT, I also have managerial positions in a BPO, and a Digital Agency.

My specialties include Business Management, Project Management, Digital Marketing, Data Analytics, Cybersecurity, IT Support, Website Development and Sales Management.

Some of my accomplishments include:
- Representing Zimbabwe at the BRICS Youth Innovation Summit (2023)
- Becoming a 2022 Tony Elumelu Foundation Alumni, where I also received seed capital grant funding as well as certified in Business Management.

To deliver measurable results to clients

My Mission

To use digital channels to reach customers, build brand awareness, and promote products and services.

My Goal

To learn the diverse cultures of people who I will work with both locally and internationally.

Who am i

Entrepreneur and Freelance designer with a million ideas.

I have an acute sense of Design Thinking which I use very often in all my work.

My Rules

I believe in working within set and goals, and as such I provide all my clients with a contract agreement document that both parties sign on. The document can be adjusted to the clients preference of course.

My Services

  • Digital Marketing
  • Website Development
  • Data Analytics

My Ideal Clients

  • Startups
  • Small Businesses
  • E-commerce Businesses
  • Local & International Businesses

My Skills

I am skilled and experienced.

I have over 2 years of experience in Digital Marketing, Website Development, Project Management, Data Analytics, Business Development and Sales Management.

2022 Business Management

Tony Elumelu Foundation

I participated in the 2022 Tony Elumelu Foundation entrepreneur competition, and was awarded non-equity based grant funding for my Startup. I also became a 2022 TEF Alumni.

Read More

2022 Digital Marketing

Hubspot Academy

I was certified by HubSpot Academy in Digital Marketing, after having completed the course.

Read More

2023 Front-end Development

Meta

I was certified by Meta in Front-end Development, after having completed the course.

Read More

2024 Data Analytics

Hotjar

I was certified by Hotjar, after having completed the courses.

Read More Menu

  • My Services

    • Digital Marketing
  • Hire Me

Let's connect on my social media accounts

My Portfolio

Website Development
I make custom built websites, including web hosting plans with security. $500
  • 5
    Digital Marketing
    I provide Digital marketing services along with branding. $500
  • 5
    Project Management
    I provide Project management services, to ensure your projects are completed in a timely and cost effective way. $800
  • 3.5
    IT Support
    I provide IT Support to your ICT equipment $500
  • 5 Load More

item.dc:creator: kelvinator1
item.content:encoded:
• Home

    • Entrepreneur

    • Website Development
    • Digital Marketing
  • My Services
    • Website Development
    • Digital Marketing
  • Hire Me

Ventures

Refuse iT (Pvt) Ltd

Refuse iT is promoting the recoupling of economic and social prosperity with environmental sustainability through Recycling, DIY (Do It Yourself) projects, and Freelance services. Essentially, we are creating a circular economy within the waste management industry through emerging technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, and IoT.

 

 

Project Brief

According to research done in 2020 by the Environmental Management Agency (EMA), Zimbabwe generates 1, 7 million tonnes of solid waste annually. Only 12% of this is plastic waste which is approximately 198 000 tonnes. Poor waste management systems of over 20 years have resulted in the drastic accumulation of refuse waste landfills in low-no income high density residential areas. Unfortunately, this problem has found its way into Central Business Districts leading not only into a health hazard but also a sour sight for pedestrians. The problem with refuse waste landfills apart from poor waste management systems is, you are paying tax money for services not carried out. . According to the statutory Instrument 68 (2021) under Harare (Incorporated and Local Government Areas) (Waste Management) (Amendment) By-Laws, 2021 (No. 28), refuse collection fee per month of high density residential areas is ZWL 565, to be precise. This figure could well as be neglible since Zimbabwe as of July 2022 is experiencing a hyperinflation rate of 595%. To curb the waste management gaps, recycling companies emerged and offered their refuse collection services on a monthly subscription basis door-door service. This proved to be unsustainable as residents living in low-no income high density residential areas could not afford the monthly subscription and ended up neglected once again. Another reason why this approach failed is the recycling companies have not addressed the real problem of, What to do with the collected waste. Instead, they just dump the waste at a dumping site and let it pile up once again. Informal waste pickers play a vital role in waste management unfortunately, they are exploited by recycling company middlemen. This exploitation is mainly due to them being at the bottom of the social hierarchy and as a result have no support. The problem being experienced in the country is that of Refuse waste landfills, Lack of employment, and Lack of part-time income. To give a representation of how widespread the problem of refuse waste is, According to the Zimbabwe National Statistics Agency (ZIMSTATS) 2022, Zimbabwe has a population of 15 178 979 and the national average household size was 4,0. Each resident in a high and low income residential area was discarding on average, approximately 0,481 kg and 0,301 kg per day respectively of solid waste of which 60-80% was compostable or biodegradable waste. That is the amount of waste an individual among 15 million other individuals discards in a single day. The problem is nation-wide but more centralized within the low-no income high density residential areas. It is of prime importance that refuse waste problem is solved and can be incentivized to help alleviate the unemployment rate which is currently at 5,7% to cater for youths aged 16-35 who make up 67,7% of the total population.

 

 

Project Info

Founder : Tafadzwa Kevin Chingombe

Industry : ICT

Date Formed : August 21, 2022

Website : (Still Pending)

iContact Africa Solutions (Pvt) Ltd

iContact Africa Solutions is an Outsourcing company based in Zimbabwe. Our main service offerings are Front-end Development, Digital Marketing, Telemarketing, Cybersecurity, Project Management, and Data Analytics.

Project Brief

iContact Africa Solutions is an outsourcing company that helps Early stage startups to make sound strategic investments and decisions. We specialize in data driven approaches, by making use of user behavior analytics tools that gives you insights into how users behave on your site, what they need, and how they feel, fast. We are the right solution for Product teams, and Marketing teams that want to go beyond traditional web and product analytics so they can empathize with and understand their users—to connect the dots between what's happening and why it happens, so they can improve the user experience (UX) and create customer delight.

We offer our clients the following services: 

  • Website Development
  • Digital marketing
  • Data Analytics

Project Info

Founder : Tafadzwa Kevin Chingombe

Industry : Services

Date Formed : October 13, 2023

Website : iContact Africa Solutions

edit post

Hello world!

September 26, 2023

Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

Read More

Tafadzwa Chingombe

If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor.

About

From age 10 I've always knew I was meant for something greater than myself, and it was not until I was at university that I realized my true purpose of socially impacting other peoples lives.

Being a social entrepreneur is my passion. I wake up every morning excited to lead a team of highly motivated and skilled youths towards the green economy of Zimbabwe.

In my 3 years of being the founder of Refuse iT, I've found that the waste management industry particularly in Zimbabwe has a long way to go in terms of digitization and innovation.

My specialties include Business Management, Project Management, Digital Marketing, Data Analytics, Cybersecurity, IT Support and Sales Management.

Some of my accomplishments include:
- Representing Zimbabwe at the BRICS Youth Innovation Summit (2023)
- Becoming a 2022 Tony Elumelu Foundation Alumni, where I also received seed capital grant funding as well as certified in Business Management.
- Selected as one of the top 15 finalists in the Generation Unlimited Youth Innovation Challenge in Zimbabwe (2022)

I'd love to hear from you. Reach out to me here on LinkedIn, or email me on chingombet@gmail.com

item.title: Digital Marketing
item.dc:creator: kelvinator1
item.content:encoded:
• Home
  • About
    • Ventures
    • Entrepreneur

    • IT Support

    • Business Development
    • IT Support
  • Blog & News
  • Contact Me

Digital Marketing

Digital Marketing

I have over 2 years of experience working as a Digital Marketing Specialist. I have successfully provided local (Zimbabwe) and International (Australia and Canada) clients’ projects within our agreed upon timeframe. I have an understanding of Creating Search engine-friendly content, Optimising a website, Creating a social media strategy, Using video to engage audience, Amplifying messaging with advertisements, and measuring the results of my marketing efforts. I am also skilled in User Interface Design (UI) and User Experience Design (UX) as is not only evident from my qualifications but also from the projects I have completed.

 

Project Brief

Digital marketing is the use of digital channels to promote or market products or services to consumers and businesses. It includes a wide range of activities, such as search engine optimization (SEO), social media marketing, content marketing, email marketing, and pay-per-click (PPC) advertising.

I execute Digital marketing campaigns in the following steps:

  1. Define your goals and objectives. What do you want to achieve with your digital marketing campaign? Do you want to increase brand awareness, drive website traffic, generate leads, or increase sales? Once you know your goals, you can develop a strategy to achieve them.
  2. Identify your target audience. Who are you trying to reach with your digital marketing campaign? Once you know your target audience, you can tailor your messaging and targeting accordingly.
  3. Choose the right digital marketing channels. There are many different digital marketing channels available, so it's important to choose the ones that are right for your business and target audience. For example, if you're targeting businesses, LinkedIn may be a good channel to use. If you're targeting consumers, social media platforms like Facebook and Instagram may be a better choice.
  4. Create high-quality content. No matter what digital marketing channels you choose, it's important to create high-quality content that will engage your target audience and encourage them to take action.
  5. Track and measure your results. Once your campaign is up and running, it's important to track your results so you can see what's working and what's not. This will help you optimize your campaign and improve your results over time.

The outcomes of digital marketing vary depending on the specific goals of your campaign. However, some common outcomes include:

  • Increased brand awareness
  • Increased website traffic
  • Increased leads
  • Increased sales
  • Improved customer loyalty
  • Better customer insights

Project Info

Tools : Asana, Canva, Adobe illustrator, Meta Business Suite, 

Project Timeline : 1 month

Category : Digital Marketing

Pricing

$

250

/mo

Basic Plan
  • Digital Marketing Strategy
  • Content Creation
  • Content Style Guide
  • Content Creation Framework
Apply Now

$

350

/mo

Business
  • Basic Plan+
  • Quality Blog Content
  • Video Marketing Strategy
  • Social Media Strategy
Apply Now

Interested in a custom plan?

Get in touch

$

500

/mo

Exclusive
  • Business Plan+
  • Improve Website Performance
  • Search Engine Optimisation
  • High Perfoming E-mail
Apply Now

hAve more questions?

1. Briefly explain Digital Marketing.

It is a domain that involves scaling brands and products online to bring about value addition by making use of a plethora of concepts, such as SEO, and channels such as email, social media, and more.

2. What are the types of Digital Marketing in the industry?

There are a wide variety of concepts pertaining to Digital Marketing. Here are some:

  • Email marketing
  • Social media marketing
  • Search engine optimization (SEO)
  • Affiliate marketing
  • Content marketing
  • Search Engine Marketing (SEM)
  • Pay-per-click advertising (PPC)
3. Define SEO in brief

This is one of the most frequently asked questions in a digital marketing interview.

Search Engine Optimization, or SEO for short, is the structured solution to the requirement of an increase in incoming traffic to a web page. This directly correlates to an increase in the number, as well as the quality, of the traffic generated based on certain criteria used to attain it.

4. What are keywords? Why are they considered important in this domain?

Any digital marketing interview is not completed without this question and answer. Keywords are the literal key search phrases users use to search for a product, brand, or anything of their choice. This forms to be the primary entity used when working with the concept of search engine optimization (SEO). A keyword has the utmost importance when used well and analyzed diligently; it has the ability to draw in a lot of organic traffic. This directly results in users landing on a website optimized for keywords in any search engine.

5. Where can all keywords be used to drive more traffic to a website?

Keywords can be used in a variety of places such as:

  • Web page title
  • Web page URL
  • Meta description
  • Website content
  • Headings
6. What are the two main ways of Digital Marketing?

This is one of the most important Digital Marketing interview questions and answers asked. So, answer this one wisely!

There are inbound and outbound marketing techniques. In Inbound Marketing, the main focus is customer-centric, and the content is created around that, e.g., blogs, social media channels, and more. Outbound marketing deals with the direct need of the product and is usually distributed to a wideband audience, through billboards, televised advertisements, magazines, etc.

7. What is pay-per-click advertising?

Pay-Per-Click is a Digital Marketing methodology that involves the advertiser paying the website owner a discussed amount of money every time the advertisement is clicked on by a user.

Most Pay-Per-Click advertising is of three types. They are search ads, display ads, and social media ads. Search ads are found on platforms like google,  bing, yahoo, etc. Third-party apps have display ads and platforms like Facebook,  Instagram are for social media ads.

Pay-per-click, along with cost per impression (CPM) is used to evaluate the cost-effectiveness and feasibility of internet ads and to keep the cost of conducting ad campaigns as minimal as possible when meeting defined goals.

Still got questions?

Website Development

WEBSITE DEVELOPMENT

I have over 2 years of experience working as a Front-end Web Developer. I have successfully provided local (Zimbabwe) and International (Australia) clients' projects within our agreed upon timeframe. I am skilled in HTML,  CSS, and Javascript. I am also skilled in User Interface Design (UI) and User Experience Design (UX) as is not only evident from my qualifications but also from the projects I have completed.

Project Brief

I primarily focus on Front-end development, which entails that I am fully equipped with the right knowledge to design a fully functional and responsive website for my client. Initially, the client and I will have a consultation session so we can establish the clients expectations and what exactly they need to be built. The Consultation session is where we layout the SMART (Specific, Measurable, Attainable, Relevant, and Time-Bound) goals for the project.

I have a large collection of design templates that I am willing to share with the client to select from. As for the Project Timeline, I can finish designing the website within 2 weeks provided the client provides all information in a timely manner.

The client will also get a contract agreement document, that both parties sign on. It will be open to amendments regarding how we will carry out our relationship during the course of our agreement time. 

Project Info

Designer : Tafadzwa Chingombe

Project Timeline : 2-3 Weeks

Category : Web Development

Contact Me: +263718574277

Pricing

$

250

  • Cpanel

  • SSL Security

Interested in a custom plan?

Book a consultation session

700

Exclusive
  • Business Plan+
  • Exclusive Support
  • SEO
  • 15 Email Accounts
  • 30 Hosted Domains
  • 15 GB NVMe SSD
Apply Now

hAve more questions?

1. What is Wordpress?

WordPress is a best Open Source CMS which allows it to be used free of cost.  You can use it on any personal or commercial website without having to pay a single penny for it. It is built on PHP/MySQL (which is again Open Source) and licensed under GPL.

2. How safe is a website on Wordpress?

You can use WordPress for e-commerce sites, membership sites, photo galleries and any other type of site you can think of. The website is created using the same HTML code as any other site, so there are no limitations there either.

3. Do you need to have a blog in order to use WordPress for a site?

WordPress was originally used as blogging software though it has since become popular for the website also.  It is not necessary to have a blog to use WordPress.  Still having a blog is commendable as it will help in search engine optimization.

  4. From SEO point of view is WordPress helpful? Will it show the website on Google?

It is one of the benefits of using WordPress; it has inbuilt SEO search engine. Also, you can have an additional plug-in in WordPress to help with SEO and rank on a popular search engine like Google.

5. What is the current version of WordPress?

You need to quote the current version of WordPress available in the market along with the release date.

6. What do you mean by a custom field in WordPress?

The custom field is a meta-data that allows you to store arbitrary information in the WordPress post. Through custom field, extra information can be added to the post.

7. What are the positive aspects of WordPress?

Few positive aspects of WordPress are

  • Easy installation and upgrade
  • In-built SEO engine
  • Easy theme system
  • Flexibility
  • Multilingual- available in more than 70 languages
  • Own data- no unwanted advert on your website
  • Flexibility and Easy publishing option

Still got questions?

item.title: Business Development
item.dc:creator: kelvinator1
item.content:encoded:

Business Development

Business Development

I have over 2 years of experience working as a Business Developer. I have successfully developed a Green-tech based company, and also an Outsourcing company. My other works are aligned with the various clients I encounter. I am skilled in Project Management,  Negotiation skills, Communication skills, and Computer skills. I am also skilled in Problem solving skills.

Project Brief

As a business developer I am  responsible for generating new leads, developing relationships with potential clients, and closing deals. I work to identify and qualify new opportunities, develop sales proposals, and negotiate contracts. I also play a vital role in helping organizations grow and achieve their business goals.

As a Business developer I use a variety of tools to help me succeed in my role. Some common tools I use include:

  • Customer relationship management (CRM) software: CRM software helps business developers to track their leads and opportunities, manage their relationships with clients, and automate their sales process.
  • Email marketing software: Email marketing software is used to send targeted email campaigns to potential and existing clients.
  • Social media marketing tools: Social media marketing tools are used to build relationships with potential and existing clients on social media platforms such as LinkedIn and Twitter.
  • Presentation software: Presentation software is used to create and deliver sales presentations to potential clients.

The outcomes of a successful business development project can vary depending on the specific goals of the project. However, some common outcomes include:

  • Increased sales: A successful business development project should result in an increase in sales for the organization.
  • New customers: A successful business development project should also result in the acquisition of new customers.
  • Expanded market share: A successful business development project can also help organizations to expand their market share.
  • Increased brand awareness: A successful business development project can also help organizations to increase their brand awareness.

 

Project Info

Contact Me : +263718574277

Project Timeline : 1 Month

Category : Business Development

$

200

/mo

  • Lead Generation
  • Sales Prospecting
  • Sales Proposal Development
  • Contract Negotiations
Apply Now

$

350

/mo

  • Market Research
  • Partnership Development
Apply Now

Get in touch

$

500

/mo

Exclusive
  • Business Plan+
  • Public Relations
  • Event Marketing
  • Social Media Marketing
Apply Now

hAve more questions?

1. As a Business Development Executive, how would you handle client expectations?

By working as a professional in business development, I will focus all my attention on bringing business for the company I’m affiliated with. Of course, the only way to do this is by balancing the needs of the client with their expectations and then understanding how it will benefit them in the short and long-term. 

Here’s my approach to handle their expectations:

– Engage in a detailed interaction with the client to fully understand their needs and expectations

– Then continuously stay in touch with them and let them know about the progress that is being made 

I feel that by doing this, we will be able to deliver total transparency to the client. And if their expectations aren’t being met, we can quickly interact via our open communication channels. 

By being transparent and communicating effectively, we can efficiently handle their expectations without expending vast quantities of the company’s resources.

2. Which departments within the organization do you collaborate with as a Business Development Executive?

At the end of the day, the role of a business development executive within the organization is to do anything possible to grow the business. For this to happen, I will need to stay up-to-date about the latest trends and upcoming products. And what better way to do this than collaborating closely with both the product and sales teams? 

By closely working with professionals from the sales and product teams, we will be efficient in our approach as a team to drive sales, generate revenue, and help the company grow. Another benefit of working together is that we will be able to freely share our viewpoints, reservations, and objections about anything at all without engaging in any kind of conflict. 

3. What is going to be your approach if the customer wants a specific feature added or removed from a product(service) offered by the company?

In our job, we have to deal with many requirements of a client and it can get a little daunting since we approach multiple clients with a particular product.

So, my first step of action is to set up a meeting with the product manager and the client since the former can understand and explain the reaction of the required feature better to the client.

If it is something extremely specific for the client I will have to work up a particular revenue figure, which will be pre-agreed upon as my responsibility is to ensure business to not just my company but that my client is satisfied.

4. How would you measure success as a Business Development Executive?

Success can be quantified as both short and long-term, and I do the same as a Business Development Executive.

In the case of short-term success, there is tremendous value. Ultimately, they build towards long-term success. They couple beautifully with setbacks to provide the necessary learning and motivation. As for long-term success, I feel that it holds more value, not just for me but also for the organization.

Long story short, I personally measure success on two parameters: the relationships that I steadily build with the clients that results in more business, sizable increase in revenue, and substantial business growth.

5. Tell us about your plan of action if you get to know that a loyal customer is leaving us for a competitor?

Thinking back to my previous years in XYZ company, there was a particular instance where a loyal customer who had been with us for years suddenly decided to opt out and switch over to our competitor.

My plan of action involved uncovering why (or what) led to our client leaving us for our competitor. Once the facts were established, I personally got in touch with the client to provide more services and more discounts on bulk orders. I also gave them my word that whatever dissatisfied them would be fixed and that we’d work towards improving our offerings.

This led to them feeling reassured that our company was invested in serving them and that we thought of them as a high-priority client.

6. As a Business Development Executive, how do you work with the product team?

From Day 1 as a Business Development Executive my priority is clear—to bring as much business as possible for the company. But this can only happen (or be effective) if the BD team closely collaborates with the product team. 

As a professional business development executive, I always maintain an excellent rapport with the product team. I honestly believe that as long as the co-working relationship between two teams is professional and genuine, work becomes easier. 

For instance, I can easily get in touch with the right personnel to know anything about the product and relay my feedback to the concerned team(or individual) to boost sales.

7. Can you explain how you can simultaneously maintain the balance between old customers and new ones?

I always turn to the organization’s Customer Management System(CMS) and tools like Google Calendar to find the right balance. For instance, whenever I interact with a prospect or a client, I feed important details from my conversation with the prospect into the CMS and then set up the date and time in my Google Calendar for my follow-up with the same prospect. 

The calendar also comes handy when I need to carve out time everyday to speak to new leads. I again take the same information and feed it into the CMS whilst scheduling follow-ups in my calendar.

By efficiently using resources like the CMS and calendar, I don’t only record important details of my interactions which I can always refer to anytime I want, but also ensure that new clients and existing customers are never forgotten.

8. As a Business Development Executive, how would you build new relationships?

The crucial element in building customer relationships is trust. As a business development executive, I always ensure that trust is maintained which can only happen if all my relationships with clients are holistic. By doing this, I also create opportunities for myself or my team to be invited to events where I can build a rapport with prospects and business representatives.

Starting any new relationship or interaction with a sales pitch is a big no for me because prospects and clients can respond negatively. Instead, to pitch my idea at the opportune moment, I lean towards exchanging business cards with the prospect, communicate for a few days, and then set up a meeting in a casual setting or environment, like a restaurant or a cafe.

I try my best to sell my idea(product or service) and if the prospect entertains it, I set-up a follow-up, preferably in their office premises to peruse requirements and legalities. But if they object to my pitch, I take the rejection in a constructive manner and then ask for their valuable feedback. By doing this, I pave the way for interactions in the future even if the first business idea is rejected by the prospect.

9. As a Business Development Executive, how will you find new business opportunities?

There are many ways to go about it. One of the things I do is network and attend fairs which help me to interact with prospects. Of course, I also turn to LinkedIn and Google to uncover business organisations who may need our service(or product), or cold-call.

Another method I actively leverage is competitor analysis. I try to know what the competitor is upto, find out who their clientele is, and do my level best to convince them to try our services(or products) simultaneously, or better yet, switch over to us. 

At the end of the day, it all boils down to the experience and connections of the business development executive which I already possess. I think the company can greatly benefit from my primary, secondary and tertiary connections to identify new business opportunities.

10. What factors do you consider when evaluating a deal with the customer?

There are several factors that every Business Development Executive should consider.

For instance, it’s essential to understand from the very first interaction with the client if they are a one-time or repeat buyer. And if valuable resources like time and effort are being spent on this prospect, will they immediately switch over to a direct competitor if they aren’t satisfied with the offering, or be very satisfied to a point where they recommend it to others?

The magnitude of the deal must also be investigated. Every company has liabilities; so, if a contract is signed with the client can the company fulfil it keeping in mind its liabilities? 

The company might have to give the deal a second thought if it doesn’t align with the sales strategy. Every deal must be studied carefully, so should every client relationship. Even if the deal with the client doesn’t seem feasible, it’s wise not to quickly reject it. The business development executive must consider it and find a workaround so that it’s beneficial for both the client and the company. 

Still got questions?

As a business developer I am \u00a0responsible for generating new leads, developing relationships with potential clients, and closing deals. I work to identify and qualify new opportunities, develop sales proposals, and negotiate contracts. I also play a vital role in helping organizations grow and achieve their business goals.<\/p>

As a Business developer I use a variety of tools to help me succeed in my role. Some common tools I use include:<\/p>

  • Customer relationship management (CRM) software:<\/strong> CRM software helps business developers to track their leads and opportunities, manage their relationships with clients, and automate their sales process.<\/li>
  • Email marketing software:<\/strong> Email marketing software is used to send targeted email campaigns to potential and existing clients.<\/li>
  • Social media marketing tools:<\/strong> Social media marketing tools are used to build relationships with potential and existing clients on social media platforms such as LinkedIn and Twitter.<\/li>
  • Presentation software:<\/strong> Presentation software is used to create and deliver sales presentations to potential clients.<\/li><\/ul>

    The outcomes of a successful business development project can vary depending on the specific goals of the project. However, some common outcomes include:<\/p>

    • Increased sales: A successful business development project should result in an increase in sales for the organization.<\/li>
    • New customers: A successful business development project should also result in the acquisition of new customers.<\/li>
    • Expanded market share: A successful business development project can also help organizations to expand their market share.<\/li>
    • Increased brand awareness: A successful business development project can also help organizations to increase their brand awareness.<\/li><\/ul>

questions?","align":"center","typography_typography":"custom","typography_font_family":"Cabin","typography_font_size":{"unit":"em","size":1.4},"typography_font_weight":"900","typography_text_transform":"uppercase","typography_line_height":{"unit":"em","size":3.1},"typography_letter_spacing":{"unit":"px","size":8},"_padding":{"unit":"em","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":false},"_margin":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":""},"typography_font_size_mobile":{"unit":"rem","size":1.2},"_padding_mobile":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":"1"},"align_tablet":"center","typography_line_height_mobile":{"unit":"em","size":1.5,"sizes":[]},"__globals__":{"title_color":"globals\/colors?id=primary"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"heading"},{"id":"2890d5cc","elType":"widget","settings":{"tabs":[{"tab_title":"1. As a Business Development Executive, how would you handle client expectations?","tab_content":"

      By working as a professional in business development, I will focus all my attention on bringing business for the company I'm affiliated with. Of course, the only way to do this is by balancing the needs of the client with their expectations and then understanding how it will benefit them in the short and long-term.\u00a0<\/p>

      Here's my approach to handle their expectations:<\/p>

      - Engage in a detailed interaction with the client to fully understand their needs and expectations<\/p>

      - Then continuously stay in touch with them and let them know about the progress that is being made\u00a0<\/p>

      I feel that by doing this, we will be able to deliver total transparency to the client. And if their expectations aren't being met, we can quickly interact via our open communication channels.\u00a0<\/p>

      By being transparent and communicating effectively, we can efficiently handle their expectations without expending vast quantities of the company's resources.<\/p>","_id":"9ee9b18"},{"tab_title":"2. Which departments within the organization do you collaborate with as a Business Development Executive?","tab_content":"

      At the end of the day, the role of a business development executive within the organization is to do anything possible to grow the business. For this to happen, I will need to stay up-to-date about the latest trends and upcoming products. And what better way to do this than collaborating closely with both the product and sales teams?\u00a0<\/p>

      By closely working with professionals from the sales and product teams, we will be efficient in our approach as a team to drive sales, generate revenue, and help the company grow. Another benefit of working together is that we will be able to freely share our viewpoints, reservations, and objections about anything at all without engaging in any kind of conflict.\u00a0<\/p>","_id":"b0a507e"},{"tab_title":"3. What is going to be your approach if the customer wants a specific feature added or removed from a product(service) offered by the company?","tab_content":"

      In our job, we have to deal with many requirements of a client and it can get a little daunting since we approach multiple clients with a particular product.<\/p>

      So, my first step of action is to set up a meeting with the product manager and the client since the former can understand and explain the reaction of the required feature better to the client.<\/p>

      If it is something extremely specific for the client I will have to work up a particular revenue figure, which will be pre-agreed upon as my responsibility is to ensure business to not just my company but that my client is satisfied.<\/p>","_id":"a71416c"},{"tab_title":"4. How would you measure success as a Business Development Executive?","tab_content":"

      Success can be quantified as both short and long-term, and I do the same as a Business Development Executive.<\/p>

      In the case of short-term success, there is tremendous value. Ultimately, they build towards long-term success. They couple beautifully with setbacks to provide the necessary learning and motivation. As for long-term success, I feel that it holds more value, not just for me but also for the organization.<\/p>

      Long story short, I personally measure success on two parameters: the relationships that I steadily build with the clients that results in more business, sizable increase in revenue, and substantial business growth.<\/p>","_id":"0396879"},{"tab_title":"5. Tell us about your plan of action if you get to know that a loyal customer is leaving us for a competitor?","tab_content":"

      Thinking back to my previous years in XYZ company, there was a particular instance where a loyal customer who had been with us for years suddenly decided to opt out and switch over to our competitor.<\/p>

      My plan of action involved uncovering why (or what) led to our client leaving us for our competitor. Once the facts were established, I personally got in touch with the client to provide more services and more discounts on bulk orders. I also gave them my word that whatever dissatisfied them would be fixed and that we'd work towards improving our offerings.<\/p>

      This led to them feeling reassured that our company was invested in serving them and that we thought of them as a high-priority client.<\/p>","_id":"18bfc4a"},{"tab_title":"6. As a Business Development Executive, how do you work with the product team?","tab_content":"

      From Day 1 as a Business Development Executive my priority is clear\u2014to bring as much business as possible for the company. But this can only happen (or be effective) if the BD team closely collaborates with the product team.\u00a0<\/p>

      As a professional business development executive, I always maintain an excellent rapport with the product team. I honestly believe that as long as the co-working relationship between two teams is professional and genuine, work becomes easier.\u00a0<\/p>

      For instance, I can easily get in touch with the right personnel to know anything about the product and relay my feedback to the concerned team(or individual) to boost sales.<\/p>","_id":"85d4c23"},{"tab_title":"7. Can you explain how you can simultaneously maintain the balance between old customers and new ones?","tab_content":"

      I always turn to the organization's Customer Management System(CMS) and tools like Google Calendar to find the right balance. For instance, whenever I interact with a prospect or a client, I feed important details from my conversation with the prospect into the CMS and then set up the date and time in my Google Calendar for my follow-up with the same prospect.\u00a0<\/p>

      The calendar also comes handy when I need to carve out time everyday to speak to new leads. I again take the same information and feed it into the CMS whilst scheduling follow-ups in my calendar.<\/p>

      By efficiently using resources like the CMS and calendar, I don't only record important details of my interactions which I can always refer to anytime I want, but also ensure that new clients and existing customers are never forgotten.<\/p>","_id":"ed5b571"},{"_id":"90ac2f7","tab_title":"8. As a Business Development Executive, how would you build new relationships?","tab_content":"

      The crucial element in building customer relationships is trust. As a business development executive, I always ensure that trust is maintained which can only happen if all my relationships with clients are holistic. By doing this, I also create opportunities for myself or my team to be invited to events where I can build a rapport with prospects and business representatives.<\/p>

      Starting any new relationship or interaction with a sales pitch is a big no for me because prospects and clients can respond negatively. Instead, to pitch my idea at the opportune moment, I lean towards exchanging business cards with the prospect, communicate for a few days, and then set up a meeting in a casual setting or environment, like a restaurant or a cafe.<\/p>

      I try my best to sell my idea(product or service) and if the prospect entertains it, I set-up a follow-up, preferably in their office premises to peruse requirements and legalities. But if they object to my pitch, I take the rejection in a constructive manner and then ask for their valuable feedback. By doing this, I pave the way for interactions in the future even if the first business idea is rejected by the prospect.<\/p>"},{"_id":"836acd9","tab_title":"9. As a Business Development Executive, how will you find new business opportunities?","tab_content":"

      There are many ways to go about it. One of the things I do is network and attend fairs which help me to interact with prospects. Of course, I also turn to LinkedIn and Google to uncover business organisations who may need our service(or product), or cold-call.<\/p>

      Another method I actively leverage is competitor analysis. I try to know what the competitor is upto, find out who their clientele is, and do my level best to convince them to try our services(or products) simultaneously, or better yet, switch over to us.\u00a0<\/p>

      At the end of the day, it all boils down to the experience and connections of the business development executive which I already possess. I think the company can greatly benefit from my primary, secondary and tertiary connections to identify new business opportunities.<\/p>"},{"_id":"05371ee","tab_title":"10. What factors do you consider when evaluating a deal with the customer?","tab_content":"

      There are several factors that every Business Development Executive should consider.<\/p>

      For instance, it's essential to understand from the very first interaction with the client if they are a one-time or repeat buyer. And if valuable resources like time and effort are being spent on this prospect, will they immediately switch over to a direct competitor if they aren't satisfied with the offering, or be very satisfied to a point where they recommend it to others?<\/p>

      The magnitude of the deal must also be investigated. Every company has liabilities; so, if a contract is signed with the client can the company fulfil it keeping in mind its liabilities?\u00a0<\/p>

      The company might have to give the deal a second thought if it doesn't align with the sales strategy. Every deal must be studied carefully, so should every client relationship. Even if the deal with the client doesn't seem feasible, it's wise not to quickly reject it. The business development executive must consider it and find a workaround so that it's beneficial for both the client and the company.\u00a0<\/p>"}],"border_width":{"unit":"px","size":1},"space_between":{"unit":"px","size":"5"},"box_shadow_box_shadow":{"horizontal":"0","vertical":"0","blur":"30","spread":"0","color":"rgba(0,0,0,0.12)"},"title_padding":{"unit":"em","top":"3","right":"3","bottom":"3","left":"3","isLinked":"1"},"icon_align":"right","content_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"35","bottom":"15","left":"35","isLinked":""},"border_color":"#f7f7f7","title_typography_typography":"custom","title_typography_font_size":{"unit":"em","size":0.8},"title_typography_font_weight":"600","title_typography_text_transform":"uppercase","content_typography_typography":"custom","content_typography_font_size":{"unit":"rem","size":0.9},"content_typography_font_weight":"300","content_typography_line_height":{"unit":"em","size":1.6},"_border_width":{"unit":"px","top":"1","right":"1","bottom":"0","left":"1","isLinked":false},"_padding_mobile":{"unit":"px","top":"15","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":""},"_background_background":"classic","_background_color":"#ffffff","icon":"fa Project Management

Project Management

I have over 2 years of experience working as a Project Manager for local (Zimbabwe) and international clients (Canada and Australia). A project manager is a professional who is responsible for the planning, execution, and completion of projects. They work with a team of people to achieve the project's goals on time, within budget, and to the required standard.

 

Project Brief

Project management is the process of planning, executing, and monitoring projects to ensure that they are completed on time, within budget, and to the required standard. It is a systematic approach to managing the various aspects of a project, including the scope, schedule, budget, resources, risks, and stakeholders.

I execute Project management in the following steps:

  1. Initiation: This phase involves identifying the need for the project, defining the project's goals and objectives, and securing approval for the project.
  2. Planning: This phase involves developing a detailed project plan, which includes the scope of work, schedule, budget, resources, and risks.
  3. Execution: This phase involves carrying out the project according to the plan.
  4. Monitoring and control: This phase involves tracking progress against the plan, identifying and addressing any problems, and making necessary adjustments to the plan.
  5. Closure: This phase involves completing the project, delivering the final product or service to the customer, and closing out all contracts and agreements.

The outcomes of project management vary depending on the specific project. However, some common outcomes include:

  • Successful completion of the project on time, within budget, and to the required standard
  • Increased team productivity and efficiency
  • Improved customer satisfaction
  • Reduced risk of project failure

Project Info

Tools : Asana, Slack, Microsoft Teams, Google Workspace,DropBox, Google drive

Timeline : Depends on Type of project

Category : Project Management

I have over 2 years of experience working as a Project Manager for local (Zimbabwe) and international clients (Canada and Australia).\u00a0A project manager is a professional who is responsible for the planning, execution, and completion of projects. They work with a team of people to achieve the project's goals on time, within budget, and to the required standard.<\/p><\/div><\/div><\/div><\/div><\/div><\/section>

Project management is the process of planning, executing, and monitoring projects to ensure that they are completed on time, within budget, and to the required standard. It is a systematic approach to managing the various aspects of a project, including the scope, schedule, budget, resources, risks, and stakeholders.<\/p>

I execute\u00a0Project management in the following steps:<\/p>

  1. Initiation:<\/strong> This phase involves identifying the need for the project, defining the project's goals and objectives, and securing approval for the project.<\/li>
  2. Planning:<\/strong> This phase involves developing a detailed project plan, which includes the scope of work, schedule, budget, resources, and risks.<\/li>
  3. Execution:<\/strong> This phase involves carrying out the project according to the plan.<\/li>
  4. Monitoring and control:<\/strong> This phase involves tracking progress against the plan, identifying and addressing any problems, and making necessary adjustments to the plan.<\/li>
  5. Closure:<\/strong> This phase involves completing the project, delivering the final product or service to the customer, and closing out all contracts and agreements.<\/li><\/ol>

    The outcomes of project management vary depending on the specific project. However, some common outcomes include:<\/p>

    • Successful completion of the project on time, within budget, and to the required standard<\/li>
    • Increased team productivity and efficiency<\/li>
    • Improved customer satisfaction<\/li>
    • Reduced risk of project failure<\/li><\/ul>","__globals__":{"text_color":"globals\/colors?id=75ac6ae"}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"text-editor"}],"isInner":true},{"id":"732149cf","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size":14.074,"_inline_size_tablet":26,"padding":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":false}},"elements":[{"id":"740d2eea","elType":"widget","settings":{"title":"Project Info","__globals__":{"typography_typography":"","title_color":"globals\/colors?id=75ac6ae"},"header_size":"h3"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"heading"},{"id":"280a2133","elType":"widget","settings":{"editor":"

IT Support

IT Support

I have over 2 years of experience working as an IT Support specialist. I have successfully provided local (Zimbabwe) and International (Australia) clients' with IT Support. I am skilled in HTML,  CSS, and Javascript. 

Project Brief

An IT support specialist is responsible for providing technical assistance to users of computer systems and networks. They troubleshoot and resolve a wide range of technical problems, install and configure computer hardware and software, manage user accounts and permissions, perform routine maintenance on computer systems and networks, and document and track technical problems and resolutions.

IT support specialists use a variety of tools to help them perform their job duties. Some common tools include:

  • Help desk software: Help desk software helps IT support specialists to track and manage customer tickets. It can also be used to provide self-service options to customers.
  • Remote desktop software: Remote desktop software allows IT support specialists to access and control a customer's computer remotely. This can be useful for troubleshooting and resolving problems.
  • Monitoring and diagnostic tools: Monitoring and diagnostic tools can be used to monitor the performance of computer systems and networks. They can also be used to diagnose problems.
  • Other tools: IT support specialists may also use a variety of other tools, such as operating system installation media, antivirus software, and network management tools.

The outcomes of successful IT support can vary depending on the specific needs of the organization. However, some common outcomes include:

  • Resolved customer technical problems: IT support specialists should be able to resolve customer technical problems in a timely and efficient manner. This can help to reduce downtime and improve user productivity.
  • Reduced downtime for computer systems and networks: IT support specialists should be able to identify and resolve potential problems before they cause downtime. This can help to ensure that computer systems and networks are available to users when they need them.
  • Increased user satisfaction with IT services: IT support specialists should provide excellent customer service to users. This includes being responsive to user requests, providing clear and concise explanations of solutions, and being patient and helpful.
  • Improved efficiency of the IT department: IT support specialists can help to improve the efficiency of the IT department by tracking and documenting technical problems and resolutions. This information can be used to develop best practices and improve the overall quality of IT services.

 

Project Info

hAve more questions?

1. What is active directory?

Active directory authorizes and authenticates all users and computers in a window domain network, ensuring the security of the computer and software. Through active directory various functions can be managed like creating admin users, connecting to printers or external hard drives.

2. What is DHCP and what it is used for?

DHCP stands for dynamic host configuration protocol. It is used to allocate IP addresses to a large number of the computer system in a network.  It helps in managing a large number of IP’s very easily.

3. What is the scope and super scope?

The scope consists of an IP address like gateway IP, subnet mask, DNS server IP. It can be used to communicate with the other PCs in the network. The superscope becomes when you combine two or more scopes together.

4. What is DNS?

DNS means Domain Naming Service, and it is used for resolving IP addresses to name and names to IP address. DNS is like a translator for computers, computers understand the number and not the alphabet. For example, if we type like hotmail.com, the computer doesn’t understand this, so they use DNS which converts (hotmail.com) into (numbers) and then executes the command.

5. What is forward and reverse lookup in DNS?

When we convert an IP address into names is called Reverse lookup, while converting names into IP address is called Forward lookup.

6. What is ‘A’ record and what is ‘MX record’?

A’ record is also known as host record, and it can map the IP address by name. It is with this record that DNS can find out the IP address of a name. While, ‘MX record’ also known as mail exchanger record, by the help of ‘MX’ record, location of the mail server is identified.  The record is also found in DNS.

7. What is a domain?

A domain is a set of computers which network recognizes by the internet. It can be used by centrally administer computers. It is created when you install active directory.

Still got questions?

An IT support specialist is responsible for providing technical assistance to users of computer systems and networks. They troubleshoot and resolve a wide range of technical problems, install and configure computer hardware and software, manage user accounts and permissions, perform routine maintenance on computer systems and networks, and document and track technical problems and resolutions.<\/p>

IT support specialists use a variety of tools to help them perform their job duties. Some common tools include:<\/p>

  • Help desk software: Help desk software helps IT support specialists to track and manage customer tickets. It can also be used to provide self-service options to customers.<\/li>
  • Remote desktop software: Remote desktop software allows IT support specialists to access and control a customer's computer remotely. This can be useful for troubleshooting and resolving problems.<\/li>
  • Monitoring and diagnostic tools: Monitoring and diagnostic tools can be used to monitor the performance of computer systems and networks. They can also be used to diagnose problems.<\/li>
  • Other tools: IT support specialists may also use a variety of other tools, such as operating system installation media, antivirus software, and network management tools.<\/li><\/ul>

    The outcomes of successful IT support can vary depending on the specific needs of the organization. However, some common outcomes include:<\/p>

    • Resolved customer technical problems: IT support specialists should be able to resolve customer technical problems in a timely and efficient manner. This can help to reduce downtime and improve user productivity.<\/li>
    • Reduced downtime for computer systems and networks: IT support specialists should be able to identify and resolve potential problems before they cause downtime. This can help to ensure that computer systems and networks are available to users when they need them.<\/li>
    • Increased user satisfaction with IT services: IT support specialists should provide excellent customer service to users. This includes being responsive to user requests, providing clear and concise explanations of solutions, and being patient and helpful.<\/li>
    • Improved efficiency of the IT department: IT support specialists can help to improve the efficiency of the IT department by tracking and documenting technical problems and resolutions. This information can be used to develop best practices and improve the overall quality of IT services.<\/li><\/ul>

What is active directory?","tab_content":"

      Active directory authorizes and authenticates all users and computers in a window domain network, ensuring the security of the computer and software. Through active directory various functions can be managed like creating admin users, connecting to printers or external hard drives.<\/p>","_id":"9ee9b18"},{"tab_title":"2. What is DHCP and what it is used for?","tab_content":"

      DHCP stands for dynamic host configuration protocol. It is used to allocate IP addresses to a large number of the computer system in a network.\u00a0 It helps in managing a large number of IP\u2019s very easily.<\/p>","_id":"b0a507e"},{"tab_title":"3. What is the scope and super scope?","tab_content":"

      The scope consists of an IP address like gateway IP, subnet mask, DNS server IP. It can be used to communicate with the other PCs in the network. The superscope becomes when you combine two or more scopes together.<\/p>","_id":"a71416c"},{"tab_title":"4. What is DNS?","tab_content":"

      DNS means Domain Naming Service, and it is used for resolving IP addresses to name and names to IP address. DNS is like a translator for computers, computers understand the number and not the alphabet. For example, if we type like hotmail.com, the computer doesn\u2019t understand this, so they use DNS which converts (hotmail.com) into (numbers) and then executes the command.<\/p>","_id":"0396879"},{"tab_title":"5. What is forward and reverse lookup in DNS?","tab_content":"

      When we convert an IP address into names is called Reverse lookup, while converting names into IP address is called Forward lookup.<\/p>","_id":"18bfc4a"},{"tab_title":"6. What is \u2018A\u2019 record and what is \u2018MX record\u2019?","tab_content":"

      A\u2019 record is also known as host record, and it can map the IP address by name. It is with this record that DNS can find out the IP address of a name. While, \u2018MX record\u2019 also known as mail exchanger record, by the help of \u2018MX\u2019 record, location of the mail server is identified.\u00a0 The record is also found in DNS.<\/p>","_id":"85d4c23"},{"tab_title":"7. What is a domain?","tab_content":"

      A domain is a set of computers which network recognizes by the internet. It can be used by centrally administer computers. It is created when you install active directory.<\/p>","_id":"ed5b571"}],"border_width":{"unit":"px","size":1},"space_between":{"unit":"px","size":"5"},"box_shadow_box_shadow":{"horizontal":"0","vertical":"0","blur":"30","spread":"0","color":"rgba(0,0,0,0.12)"},"title_padding":{"unit":"em","top":"3","right":"3","bottom":"3","left":"3","isLinked":"1"},"icon_align":"right","content_padding":{"unit":"px","top":"0","right":"35","bottom":"15","left":"35","isLinked":""},"title_typography_typography":"custom","title_typography_font_size":{"unit":"em","size":0.8},"title_typography_font_weight":"600","title_typography_text_transform":"uppercase","content_typography_typography":"custom","content_typography_font_size":{"unit":"rem","size":0.9},"content_typography_font_weight":"300","content_typography_line_height":{"unit":"em","size":1.6},"_border_width":{"unit":"px","top":"1","right":"1","bottom":"0","left":"1","isLinked":false},"_padding_mobile":{"unit":"px","top":"15","right":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","isLinked":""},"_background_background":"classic","_background_color":"#ffffff","icon":"fa item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: kelvinator1
item.content:encoded:
Hi, I'm Tafadzwa Chingombe
Web Developer UI/UX Designer Digital Marketer Data Analyst

I have over 3 years experience creating seamless, user-friendly, and visually appealing platforms. My extensive experience in the startup community has aided me in being more empathetic towards businesses and their requirements. I strive to achieve the client's goal by implementing HTML, PHP, CSS, Javascript, and design tools such as Spline, Figma, and Canva.

Hire Me

About Me

Get To Know A Little Bit About Me

 

"The creative adult is the child who survived."

From age 10 I’ve always known I was meant for something greater than myself, and it was not until I was at university that I realized my true purpose of socially impacting other peoples lives.

Being a social entrepreneur is my passion. I wake up every morning excited to lead a team of highly motivated and skilled youths towards the green economy of Zimbabwe.

In my 3 years of being the founder of Refuse iT, I’ve found that the waste management industry particularly in Zimbabwe has a long way to go in terms of digitization and innovation.

Apart from running Refuse iT, I also co-founded an outsourcing company called iContact Africa Solutions.

Education & Experience

WordPress Developer & UI/UX Designer

3+ years of Digital Experience.

2024 - Present

Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering Honours

I am an industrious and ambitious student currently pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering Honours degree at Zimbabwe Open University. Eager to contribute to the ever-evolving tech industry, I am deeply engaged in learning the principles of software development, algorithm design, and systems analysis.

2022 - Present

Digital Marketing & Data Analytics

Driven by a desire to excel in the digital landscape, I immersed myself in the comprehensive training offered by HubSpot Academy, mastering essential skills in content marketing, SEO, social media strategy, email marketing, and analytics. I also earned certification as a data analyst from Hotjar. Through this rigorous program, I gained invaluable skills in data collection, interpretation, and visualization, with a particular focus on user behavior analytics. Proficient in leveraging Hotjar's powerful tools, I excel at transforming complex data into actionable insights, optimizing user experiences, and driving strategic decisions.

2022 - Present

Business Management

I participated in the 2022 Tony Elumelu Foundation entrepreneur competition, and was awarded non-equity based grant funding for my Startup. I also became a 2022 TEF Alumni. From there i went onto establish two businesses. One is a green-tech based company called Refuse iT and the other is an Outsourcing company called iContact Africa Solutions.

2021 - Present

WordPress Developer

I am a dynamic and self-driven individual who embarked on a journey as a self-taught WordPress developer. Initially captivated by the power and flexibility of WordPress, I delved into its inner workings, quickly realizing the necessity of mastering fundamental web technologies. With a keen eye for design and a passion for coding, I meticulously learned HTML to structure web content, CSS to style and enhance visual appeal, PHP to manage server-side logic, and JavaScript to add interactivity. Through relentless perseverance and a hands-on approach, I transformed from a curious beginner into a proficient and versatile developer, adept at creating robust and engaging websites. My self-education path is a testament to my dedication, adaptability, and commitment to continuous learning in the ever-evolving world of web development.

Services

What I Provide

I am a detail oriented person, who values working within an agreed timeframe and maximises on quality services for all my clients.

Web Development

I create seamless, user friendly, and visually appealing websites using the CMS (Content Management System) WordPress.

WordPress Development

I have been deemed knowledgeable and skilled in coding and building interactive web pages using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Data Analytics

I have invaluable skills in data collection, interpretation, and visualization, with a particular focus on user behavior analytics.

Data Analytics

I excel at transforming complex data into actionable insights, optimizing user experiences, and driving strategic decisions.

Digital Marketing

I can create effective marketing campaigns, optimize online presence, and drive business growth.

Digital Marketing

I have been deemed knowledgable and skilled in applying digital marketing practices with an inbound mindset.

Software

Tools I use for Projects

WordPress

WordPress is a widely-used open-source content management system (CMS) that allows users to create, manage, and publish websites and blogs with ease.

Canva

Canva is a versatile online graphic design tool that enables users to create a wide variety of visual content quickly and easily.

HotJar

Hotjar is a powerful, all-in-one analytics and feedback tool designed to help website owners and digital marketers understand and improve user experience on their sites.

Microsoft Clarity

Microsoft Clarity is a free web analytics tool designed to help website owners and digital marketers understand how users interact with their websites.

Figma

Figma is a cloud-based design tool primarily used for interface design, prototyping, and collaborative design work.

  • Idea List

    I look into current design trends and gather inspiration from various sources, including design websites, portfolios, and industry-specific sites.

  • Key Features

    Essential plugins are installed and configured to add functionalities such as SEO, security, and performance optimization.

  • Design

    I will explore different visual styles that align with the client's brand and preferences.

  • Development

    I select a suitable WordPress theme or create a custom theme based on the finalized design. I will code the website, integrating HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP to build the frontend and backend functionalities.

Skill

My Skill

As a seasoned WordPress developer, I possess a diverse skill set honed through years of hands-on experience and a passion for innovation. With a meticulous attention to detail and a commitment to excellence, I offer a comprehensive range of services to bring your vision to life and elevate your online presence.

Understanding Brief Research Design Process

This stage mainly involves Initial Meeting and Requirements Gathering, and Clarifying Details and Expectations.

This stage mainly involves Competitor Analysis, User Research, Technological Research, and Design Inspiration.

This stage mainly involves Wireframing, Prototyping, Visual Design, Development, Testing, Client Review and Revisions, Launch, and Post-Launch Support.

UI/UX Design 0 % WordPress Development 0 % Data Analytics 0 % Digital Marketing 0 %

My Clients

Portfolio

Visit My Portfolio

Welcome to my portfolio, where innovation meets functionality and creativity comes to life. Here, you'll find a curated collection of projects that showcase my expertise as a WordPress developer and highlight the transformative power of this versatile platform.

  • All Post
  • Website Development
Website Development

CM International

Website Development

The Dough Chef

Website Development

Annie’s Massages & Beauty Treats

Load More

End of Content.

Pricing

See My Pricing Packs

Web Development & UI/UX Design

Price starts from $ 500 Prices may go beyond $500 depending on the project scope of work and requirements. Purchase Now Two payment options are available. Either pay 50% deposit at project start and finish when project is complete, or pay 3 monthly installments
Revisions
Free Support
Team Training
Web Hosting
Professional Emails

Data Analytics

$ 500 /Month Purchase Now Two payment options are available. Either pay 50% deposit at project start and finish when project is complete, or pay 3 monthly installments
Heat Maps
Screen Recordings
Surveys
Intervies
Feedback

Digital Marketing

$ 500 /Month Prices may be less than $500 depending on the project scope of work and requirements Purchase Now Two payment options are available. Either pay 50% deposit at project start and finish when project is complete, or pay 3 monthly installments
Content Marketing
Search Engine Optimization
Social Media Strategy
Email Marketing
Analytics

Testimonial

What People Think
About Me

Christopher Melia CM International Trading, CEO Website Redesign

“I highly recommend Tafadzwa for website development. He exceeded my expectations throughout the entire process. Communication was exceptional. Moreover, his technical expertise is impressive. Overall, I am thrilled with the final product. It's not only visually appealing and user-friendly, but it also effectively achieves my business goals. I wouldn't hesitate to work with Tafadzwa again and highly recommend him to anyone seeking a skilled, reliable, and client-focused developer.”

☆ ☆ ☆ ☆ ☆ 14 February 2024 Wiseman Chingombe University of Mpumalanga, Professor Digital Marketing

"Efficiency, quality and on time delivery."

☆ ☆ ☆ ☆ ☆ 09 February 2023 Annie Ncube Annie's Massages & Beauty Treats, CEO Digital Marketing

"Thank you so much Tafadzwa, I truly appreciate having you."

☆ ☆ ☆ ☆ ☆ 16 November 2023 Rutendo Mugwagwa Zimbabwe Innovation & Legal Technology, Founder Website Development

"Thank you so much for working on it quickly."

☆ ☆ ☆ ☆ ☆ 29 October 2023

Contact Me

Let's Work Together, Get In Touch!

Use the contact form to your right and get in touch with me. No project is too small or too big.

Contact Phone

Office Phone: +263718574277

Office Email

From age 10 I’ve always known I was meant for something greater than myself, and it was not until I was at university that I realized my true purpose of socially impacting other peoples lives.

Being a social entrepreneur is my passion. I wake up every morning excited to lead a team of highly motivated and skilled youths towards the green economy of Zimbabwe.

In my 3 years of being the founder of Refuse iT, I’ve found that the waste management industry particularly in Zimbabwe has a long way to go in terms of digitization and innovation.

Apart from running Refuse iT, I also co-founded an outsourcing company called iContact Africa Solutions.

Driven by a desire to excel in the digital landscape, I immersed myself in the comprehensive training offered by HubSpot Academy, mastering essential skills in content marketing, SEO, social media strategy, email marketing, and analytics. I also earned certification as a data analyst from Hotjar. Through this rigorous program, I gained invaluable skills in data collection, interpretation, and visualization, with a particular focus on user behavior analytics. Proficient in leveraging Hotjar's powerful tools, I excel at transforming complex data into actionable insights, optimizing user experiences, and driving strategic decisions.

I participated in the 2022 Tony Elumelu Foundation entrepreneur competition, and was awarded non-equity based grant funding for my Startup. I also became a 2022 TEF Alumni. From there i went onto establish two businesses. One is a green-tech based company called Refuse iT and the other is an Outsourcing company called iContact Africa Solutions.

","repeater_year":"2021","repeater_date_label":"2022 - Present","repeater_extra_label":"","repeater_story_icon":{"value":"fas fa-circle","library":"fa-solid"},"repeater_show_year_label":"","repeater_image":{"url":"","id":""},"item_bg_color":"#E71919","repeater_triangle_bgcolor":"#E71919","repeater_story_title_color":"#FCFCFC","repeater_description_color":"#ECECEC","repeater_timeline_icon_bg_color":"","repeater_timeline_icon_color":"#E8E8E8","repeater_icon_timeline_fill_color":"#E71919","repeater_icon_border_color":"#E8E8E8","_id":"578ad36"},{"repeater_story_title":"WordPress Developer","repeater_description":"

I am a dynamic and self-driven individual who embarked on a journey as a self-taught WordPress developer. Initially captivated by the power and flexibility of WordPress, I delved into its inner workings, quickly realizing the necessity of mastering fundamental web technologies. With a keen eye for design and a passion for coding, I meticulously learned HTML to structure web content, CSS to style and enhance visual appeal, PHP to manage server-side logic, and JavaScript to add interactivity. Through relentless perseverance and a hands-on approach, I transformed from a curious beginner into a proficient and versatile developer, adept at creating robust and engaging websites. My self-education path is a testament to my dedication, adaptability, and commitment to continuous learning in the ever-evolving world of web development.
